meanings.definition: Divided into two parts or branches.
meanings.sent1: The biforate tree had two distinct sections.
meanings.sent2: The biforate road split into two paths ahead.
meanings.sent3: The biforate cake was cut perfectly in half.
meanings.sent4: Her biforate decision led to two different outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The biforate mountain stood tall with its dual peaks.

meanings.definition: Having two openings or forking into two parts.
meanings.sent1: The biforate tunnel had an entrance and an exit.
meanings.sent2: The biforate river flowed in two directions.
meanings.sent3: The biforate book had two intriguing beginnings.
meanings.sent4: His biforate mind could see both sides of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The biforate cave echoed with sounds from both openings.
